intro: Pentaschistis imatongensis, commonly known as the Imatong mountain fern, is a rare and endemic plant species found in the Imatong Mountains of South Sudan. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae, which includes various ferns and their allies. The plant is characterized by its delicate fronds that are typically divided into narrow, elongated segments. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on rocky surfaces or in moist forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
